Wow, an aircraft mechanic! That sounds really cool! So you retired at 40. That seems like a young age to retire. What field did you retire from?

Honestly, I just want to sit at home a lot of the time. Too much moving around when I was younger. I just want to sit by the lake and relax for a spell.

Oh, man. I feel honored that I could help. That is a pretty cool name! I am sure you can find a drummer in no time! Have you tried Craigslist? Just avoid the murderers and you can find someone great!
Good idea! But maybe the murderers are where the real talent is? Do you know anyone like that in your detention center?

You make a really good point. Creativity can lead drive one to madness. Or maybe it is the other way around. My bunkmate sure does tap her fingers on the bed railing a lot; maybe she is itching to be your drummer. I don't think she is a murderer though.

My favourite! We could play games and gamble after if you wanted?

Just a little bit, I'm more into ping pong myself. Do you believe in the paranormal?

user_memory: I went kayaking for the first time yesterday.
I speak French.
I am planning to go to France this summer.
dialogue: I tried Kayaking for the first time yesterday. It was fun!
That's awesome! Did you enjoy it?
Yes! It was such an adventure. I am so sore now, though. My arms were not used to all that rowing. Have you read any books in French?

I'm really glad you enjoyed it. When I haven't been in a while it really makes my shoulders and upper arms hurt the next day. No, I've never tried to read a book in French. I don't think my French skills are good enough yet!
Oh, you should give it a try. Reading a book is a great way to improve your language skills. The little prince is a great book that is easy to read and is much better in  French.
I've heard that the Little Prince is meant to be a lovely book. And I guess as it's mainly aimed at children that the language isn't too complicated?
Yes. I'm not sure if it's really aimed at children, but it's simple enough that children can understand it. The nice thing is that is also complex enough that adults enjoy it too.

I like the kind of story which is relevant for adults and kids. Well, I'll certainly have a look at trying to read it in French then! Have you thought any more about your plans to visit Europe in summer?
Yes, I know I want to go to France (because I speak the language). I am not sure where else I would like to go, or if I just want to spend the whole time in one place.
I've only every been to Paris in France, though I've heard that the south of France is beautiful. And there are also the French Alps if you like mountains.
I think I would like to climb the mountains. Have you done any mountain climbing?
I've visited the Austrian Alps before, but we went up the mountains in cable cars because we had older family members with us. It would be awesome to climb a mountain though!

user_memory: I'm getting married. I'm cost-conscious.
I'm excited about the wedding.
I need to start thinking about preparing for the wedding. I like less-expensive, personalized weddings.
I keep changing my mind about what I want for the wedding.
I want food at my reception.
dialogue: I managed to find a reasonably priced venue for the wedding.
Thats awesome. Where is it at?

It's only about 45 minutes from where we live, and it's got beautiful gardens and a large converted barn for the reception. I'm so excited!! I should start thinking about sending out invites soon. Have you been to any weddings over the past couple of years?

Oh yes. I fall into that old saying Always a bridesmaid, never a bride. LOL. My favorite one I was in was in a venue like yours. It was the least expensive one as well I helped the bride do alot of DIY with decorations and flowers.

I am sure you'll be the bride one day (if you want to be, that is!). Often the least expensive weddings feel a lot more personal don't they, as there's a bit of DIY going on. That's amazing you were able to help with the decorations and flowers, I need to start thinking about those too!

One day ( knocks on wood).  I concur completely, they feel more like a real family celebration than a big event. With doing a bit of DIY with decorations, flowers and little wedding favours. I believe they saved around 1500$.
Wow that's quite a saving, that's great. What did they have for favours, out of interest? I keep changing my mind about what I want!

Since it was in a converted barn for the reception they kept with a chic western theme had plastic little pails filled with M&Ms in the wedding colours and a ribbon tied on it that simple said their names and date.

That's adorable! So simple and yet both delicious and personalised. I do think something edible is a very good idea, thank you! I remember you saying you love cheeseburgers; would you want them to be part of your wedding catering?

You are welcome. Well because Im very thrifty, I would probably hire a mobile BBQ to do the main catering. That way they cook right there and there wont be any wasted food and it will be hot and fresh.
That's a great idea. Hot fresh food off the BBQ is making me hungry even just thinking about it. You sound like you could go into wedding planning - have you ever considered it?
No I never thought it of it really. Im just happy to help. If you need me Im at your disposal.

user_memory: I live near the beach.

My mom is living here. I go to the redwoods in the summer.

Yes we had a lovely time thank you. It was so windy and rainy here last week, but we managed to choose the perfect time to go when then sun was out and the breeze wasn't too strong! Do you live near a beach?
Yeah, but one with hot sun but cold ocean. So different from my native India which at least has warm water you can lounge in for an hour. But beach volleyball is cool
Ah yes, I hadn't thought about the fact that India would have warm water in its oceans. I've never actually played beach volleyball before but I want to try! Do you play it?
Yeah I tried it for a while, but my gangly arms failed me. Do love swimming though.
Haha! I'm sure you don't have gangly arms. Did you just play for fun or did you play in competitions? I enjoy swimming too, though I haven't been in ages.
I played for fun, but swam in competitions (wasn't that good, got up to county level backstroke champ). Where do you hike?
About an hour's drive away there is a hilly area with a massive forest. It's great for hiking in summer because the trees allow you to walk in shade rather than scorching sun. Do you hike at all?
I think I hiked a bit in the state parks around me and love the massive redwoods. I ought to take my mom out from India just to see them.
I've never seen the redwoods, but it's on my list of things to do over the next few years. I'd love to go there will my son. Is there a particular time of year you would recommend visiting?
Sorry...my mom is already with me here (not in India) but still she hasn't seen them. I can't recommend a time; I only go in the summer, when my college lets me out.
Ah yea of course I forgot you'd have to fit it around college. Well, I hope you're able to take your mom to them soon!

user_memory: My daughter is stressed.

My kids love technology.

dialogue: How did your sons algebra lesson go in school today?
He seemed like he enjoyed it actually! We'll see when it comes to test time how it goes for him! How's your daughter been doing recently?
she's been really busy.  She's really stressed out and hasn't had much time for herself.

Yeah, that's understandable with everything going on. I hope she's not keeping herself busy to avoid the emotions though. Have you been able to spend time with the grandchildren to help her get a break or is she not having it? haha.
I've been spending way too much time with them and now I'm feeling just as crazy as she is haha

haha! I know that feeling. Maybe we can all get together. I think my son would enjoy hanging out with Jason and Andrew. Lucy is more than welcome too but I think she'd get bored hanging out with the boys so no pressure there!
that would be awesome! That would be a much needed break.

We have a pool in the backyard the kids can hang out in. Lucy's more than welcome to bring a friend if that would make her more comfortable. What other activities could we do to keep them busy and give us a break? haha
Honestly they all love technology so much that we can probably give them phones or tablets and they'll leave us alone haha

Haha. It's sad that's the way things are right now. I remember just loving going for a bike ride with my family or walks. Hanging outside doing nothing seemed entertaining when I was a kid. I try to limit screen time around here because I think it makes kids so disconnected.
I know.  I try to keep myself from falling into the same trap.  I used to play sports outside all the time and now I just sit inside watching TV and playing on my phone.
Haha maybe we can go camping sometime... I'm not sure if that would be a break for us, but it would be an adventure!

Yes, I have a couple of guidebooks and I'm making lists of all the things I want to do, trying to map out what is nearby each other, and which things I could accomplish in one day.

that is really smart. travelling can be overwhelming. one of my favorite trips ever was to barcelona, but i've never been to basque counrty. how is your dog wakling business going? i've always been curious about that - it is easy to get several dogs to cooperate and walk together at the same time>

Well it's a challenge especially when a new dog is added to the mix. When they all know each other they cooperate more but sometimes it seems like they all want to go in different directions at once. Do you like dogs?

that makes sense. i do like dogs, but am more of a cat person. i think that when i am more settled down and not likely to travel as much it might make sense for me to get one. do you think you would get one, or does walking them scratch your dog itch for now?

How can you tell if someone is normal or not? Of course murdering to steal a baby can't be classed as normal. And how can someone think they'll get away with it? Just blows my mind.
Oh, I agree with you on all of that. She even tried to fool her husband and faked a pregnancy!! Talk about planning ahead. Sheesh.
Well she's not completely crazy then I guess! Maybe the fooled pregnancy was the reason for the crime in the first place... "I need a baby or he'll know I was faking!"
Oh wow! I didn't even think about that and the interviewer has not mentioned it. Evil genius! Oh! Have you seen that one? It is on Netflix, I think (Evil Genius).
I think I have seen that one but I can't remember it too well. My favorite series was Making a Murderer. Every episode a new revelation and at the end you don't know where you stand.
YEs! It is so good! Do you believe he did it>

user_memory: I love the beach.
I love American style hamburgers.

Not so much now that I'm older. Between the sweat and my joints, I haven't been out in a few months. Jackie, my pup, and I take walks along the beach every now and then, though. You'd love it.
Oh yes I do love the beach. When I want to escape Cairo, Sharm-el-Sheikh on the Red Sea is calling!
Ahh, that sounds lovely. How are you fitting in there at Cairo? I know you mentioned work was busy.
Yes. More tourists because it's the summer, but somehow the cafe owners laid off some staff because they're "getting old".
My goodness! Reminds me of my days working for airlines. You should take a break in the off season, come visit. I'll grill your favorite.
Sure. I love American style hamburgers, can't get them authentic in all of North Africa it seems. Say, when you worked for airlines, were there unsavory characters?

Anything for you dear. And unsavory characters? I'd say quite a few! You meet all kinds of people as a stewardess, you know. It's why I ended up taking a break when I was younger! I just couldn't stand the rude folks, you know?
Me neither. When people stare longer than a tenth of a second at my pale skin, they think tourist moneybag.
Poor thing! I guess Cairo isn't all roses and sunshine, then. I never understood why people had such prejudices.
Yes, the land of tuk-tuks for the people and Harleys for rebellious women. I wish I was like you, at least for a day, in a country where women working high class jobs is admired.
America isn't that great either. When I was young, women had to work twice as hard as men to get the same pay. The grass is always greener.

That's awesome!  Are you getting him anything else?

Cool, I'll get the scratching post and some ribbon. I'd love it if Bubbles would play fetch but I'm not holding my breath. What about one of those laser pointers? Do you have one of those? I've seen videos of cats going wild over them.
oh yeah, my cats go insane for those.  They'll jump up the wall at the laser if you keep it within their reach.
Okay then I'm definitely getting one of those. Say, how is your sick cat doing? Didn't you tell me one of Groucho's brothers wasn't feeling well?
he's doing a lot better.  He wasn't eating or drinking and I was about to take him to the vet, but then he started acting normally again that night.
Oh good! I'm glad to hear that. So he just starting eating again? Did you change his food or anything?
nope.  He just must not have been feeling well that day.  I was fearing the worst but it all turned out okay.
Thank goodness. I'm glad it was a false alarm. I'd freak if Bubbles got sick. So, how's work been this week? Still busy?
it's been fine, the weather hasn't been great at all so I've had a few days off.

that would be great! that will really help me save some money so I can hopefully find a place to live soon.

I'm working on my own right now.  Do you know of any programs that can help me?

Working with social security we often have to assist our clients who can't make it just on their SSI and need additional assistance. I think the best programs are there. Every town has an office. Stop in and I am sure they will help you.
thank you so much, that will really help.  How's your father doing?
My father is a workaholic. He's doing well, but I wish I got to see him more. How about you? Is your dad in the area?
I don't know where he is.  He doesn't want to talk to me.  He's embarrassed about my situation.

Ya, I hear you there! There was some distance with me and my dad too! He wasn't a fan of my pole dancing. I do miss it though, but I get it...."not respectable." Don't give up tho. He may come around. I think you just need to focus on you for right now tho.
I'm sure he'll come around eventually.  I'm glad you're getting back into pole dancing.  I know how happy it makes you.
What do you do that makes you smile?
I'm honestly happiest when I'm working on the farm.  I'd like to move back out into the country and work on one.

I don't think so. At least not right now. Maybe when it's not racing season.

Once every two weeks usually. Sometimes two times in that time frame.
Wow, you are travelling all over the place for participating in those races then? Any memorable experiences?
Yea, I usually travel all around the southeast. I'm looking at expanding my races next  year though. Most memorable is probably coming in first at the race in bham in 2014.

I read about a race up in Iowa that's supposed to be pretty intense. I'd love to try that out!

I'm not married for now. I'm dating, but they enjoy traveling with me.

Yes I did, and meditated upon the rising sun for a good half hour! I wish for the times in Ancient Egypt where the miracle of the rising sun was explained by a scarab pushing it across the sky.

Yeah, lol. I'm sure the sunrises look great with all the open spaces in Egypt. I'd love to travel there some day, but that's enough about me. How are things with you and your girlfriend? It's your anniversary today, right?

Things with my girlfriend are great. Leading up to my anniversary I feel somewhat at peace and contented. At least my parents aren't questioning my choices, and my publicly LGBT lifestyle isn't attracting too many trolls!
Lucky! I'm glad things are going so well with you. You two make a lovely couple, I'm jealous <3

Ugh, sounds like middle schoolers! I've been trying to stay busy, myself, with college coming up in the fall and all.
Oh cool! Parents proud of you for going to college? I know mine aren't too excited.
Not really. I've been arguing with them for weeks trying to get the information I need for FAFSA and applications. Nothing out of the usual but that doesn't make it hurt any less.
So sad to hear that. And even worse, I would think is that ex-boyfriend of yours! Have you tried venting to your pet fish?
Well as great as Finley is, I'm pretty sure the yelling is stressing them out. Betas aren't exactly the most sturdy, but I love the little swimmer.

He does, he just has a little puncture wound. It didn't even bleed much. It's better to be safe than sorry.

That's true - it can give a real sense of belonging

Yes - there's a regular bible study during the week and we do a lot of charity work together!

No, everyone was fine! It was best for the birds safety since it was in the road and could have gotten hit by a car!

dialogue: I've come up with a list for more places I want to visit in South Carolina. Have you thought of any places for me?

That sounds great, I will check out Myrtle Beach. Are there any beaches close to your house?

I actually don't live in South Carolina I just like to vacation there. Another great place is Hilton Head Island! I've been considering checking out Georgia for my next vacation what's your favourite tourist thing to do around home?
During the fall, check out Callaway Gardens. It's quite beautiful and the foliage during the fall creates some spectacular colors.
Ohh that sounds amazing! Might bring back some nostalgic Canadian memories for me!
Do you miss living in Canada? What are your favorite cities? I heard Montreal is great.

I kind of do. It's a beautiful country and if you find the right location theres some great snowy views in the winter time! I used to love going to this place called Bolar Mountain where you'd go tubing- you sit in a giant tube and go down a huge snow hill!
I have never been tubing before and I just took up snowboarding a few years ago. Do you miss the Canadian winters or were they too brutal?

They can be pretty brutal! If you ever get the chance try tubing out, it'll make up for the cold weather! I definitely miss the winters but I enjoy the beach so much I feel like it's a fair trade off!
I love being by the beach. As I get older, the winters are harder on my bones and skin. I just want to get away to a tropical paradise.

Haha that's fair enough! I definitely agree the tropical paradise is visually more appealing than the snow at times! Sometimes the snow just makes a brown muck when you're in the city and its not as nice as a beachy paradise!

user_memory: I completed my thesis.
I'm working to get my PhD.
I like autobiographies and science journals.
dialogue: I just complete my thesis. The scientific article really help that.
Congratulations!! How long does it take to get the thesis approved and receive your PhD?
Well usually it takes about a year and a half to finalize the thesis with the help of peer review and mentor review. What sort of books do you encourage your 3rd graders to read?
Charlottes Web and books by Judy Blume are easily digested at that age. Those books also are great for giving subtle life lessons. What books do you enjoy?
I enjoy autobiographies during my leisure time and delve into science journals more often. Do you think kids should read more non-fiction than fictional books from an early age?

That's a great question. I think because children at that age have rapidly expanding minds, the fantastical is often given to push boundaries of imagination. A lot of non-fiction books can be quite dense, even those aimed at younger readers.
Well that's true non-fiction books can dense and dry for young minds. Although do you think books help kids in developing non-verbal communications?
I think they are great in laying the foundation for critical thought and creativity. To start question how the world functions and the dynamics of social relationships, if only at a surface level.

Well creativity is what young kids master very early considering all the different media at their disposal. That's why schools and teachers like you have a hard time making them understand the facts of the present world and rightly said "the dynamics of social relationships". It must be real tough time for you to control their ever-expanding imaginations right?!?

user_memory: I have children. We went to a horse ranch together.
My daughter wants her own horse.
I have two twin children. I am a 16 week along pregnant woman.
dialogue: Have you bought the inflatable balls for your horses yet?  If so, are your horses enjoying playing with them?
Yes! We went and bought a few different colors and sizes just to see what they liked. Most of them are loving it but a couple just canter off like they are annoyed by them.
Yeah it usually varies but glad to hear you've already purchased some. How many horses you have in total by the way and what's their average age?
We have 5 total ranging from a 1 year old up to a 7 year old. Speaking of horses.. how did your horse ranch visit go? Did the kids love it?

Oh that's great. Yes, we did and we're actually planning to come back next month. Rachel my oldest who's 9 enjoyed them quite a bit, actually reminded me when I was young and I was excited to be around horses

Oh I remember being a child and wanting horses! My dad always said I Could have one in 3 weeks. Then three weeks would go by and I would ask again and he would say in 3 weeks.. and that kept on for 3 years until all of a sudden I had one and then several within a couple months!

Oh that's a bit sad to hear but I'm happy how it turned around. Three is the lucky number then! Rachel said as well "Mommy can we have a horse pretty please?". I don't want to be the bad cop, but also don't want to deceive her so I told her that was not an option but we compromised on visiting the ranch more often and I think that's a win-win for everyone
It must have been hard going to the horse ranch carrying twins though. I couldn't imagine even wanting to move at all while being pregnant. How far along are you now?

16 weeks! So is still very manageable. For obvious reasons didn't ride the horse or took part of some of the ranch activities, but otherwise I didn't have any problem with the long walks. Do you any plans with growing a family in the future or is the farm taking too much of your time these days?

Right now the farm takes so much time from me that I'm not sure if it would be selfish to start a family. I don't think I'd have enough time to be the proper parent I should be so I'm on the fence. I barely get to leave the farm as it is and certainly no longer than a couple of hours or so.
Yes, I can understand. I was the same way before. There are some trade-offs in life that one needs to make. But hey, you do you, and as long as what you're doing brings you happiness then why bother!
That's exactly how I see. There is a Greta concert coming up though so I'm debating going to it. Have you been to one?

user_memory: I have bad feet too.

Run 'til You Drop: 15 Steps Towards Self-Actualization.

My husband and I have been steadily increasing our morning runs. I'm pretty close to the half-marathong level now.  I still have 3 months to train for the marathon though, so I think it's going well.

Oh, my goal is just to finish it!  My husband will probably try to get in the top 10, but for me it's just knowing that I did it the first time.

Milk is not the only source of protein. Would you eat seaweed? It's packed with protein.
